clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Safety and Tolerability of Multiple Doses of MEDI-546 in Adult Subjects With Scleroderma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Multicenter, Open-label Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Single and Multiple Intravenous Doses of MEDI-546, a Fully Human Monoclonal Antibody Directed Against Subunit 1 of the Type I Interferon Receptor, in Adult Subjects With Scleroderma

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of a multiple-dosed drug (MEDI-546) in adults with scleroderma.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of single and multiple IV doses of MEDI-546 in adult subjects with scleroderma who have skin thickening in an area suitable for repeat biopsy.

primary_outcome.measure: The safety and tolerability of MEDI-546 will be assessed primarily by summarizing treatment-emergent AEs and SAEs.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study Day 84 for single-dose; Study Day 105 for multi-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: The secondary endpoints of the study are to assess the PK, IM, and PD of single and multiple IV doses of MEDI-546 in adult subjects with scleroderma.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study Day 84 for single-dose; Study Day 105 for multi-dose
